name: InterventionPreferencesAtEndOfLifeGrouping
title: Intervention Preferences at End of Life Grouping
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This value set includes concepts representing an individual's intervention preferences at end of life which can be expressed by the individual in his or her advance care plan.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this value set is to identify personal intervention preferences that may be relevant and could be considered by clinicians when making a treatment/care plan for the person.),(Inclusion Criteria: Include member value sets for Intervention Preferences at End of Life for LOINC and SNOMED CT.),(Exclusion Criteria: None.)

contains.display: Preference on consulting a supportive and palliative care team to help treat physical, emotional, and spiritual discomfort and support family [Reported]
Information to tell doctors if my health deteriorates due to a terminal illness and I am unable to interact meaningfully with family, friends, or surroundings [Reported]
Information to tell doctors if I have a severe, irreversible brain injury or illness and can't dress, feed, or bathe myself, or communicate my medical wishes, but can be kept alive [Reported]
Thoughts on cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) [Reported]
Preferred location to spend final days if possible to choose [Reported]
Thoughts on organ and tissue donations [Reported]
Advance directive - request for intubation
Advance directive - request for tube feeding
Advance directive - request for life support
Advance directive - request for IV fluid and support
Advance directive - request for antibiotics
Advance directive - request for resuscitation that differs from cardiopulmonary resuscitation
Other directives that have not otherwise been documented [Reported]
Thoughts on artificial nutrition and hydration [Reported]
Thoughts on resuscitation [Reported]
Thoughts on intubation [Reported]
Thoughts on tube feeding [Reported]
Thoughts on IV fluid and support [Reported]
Thoughts on antibiotics [Reported]
Thoughts on life-sustaining procedures if pregnant [Reported]
Thoughts on pain management [Reported]
Thoughts on hastening death [Reported]
Mental health treatment preferences [Reported]
